All datetime data coming into Domo is presumed to be UTC. You can setÂ the time zone for a DataSetÂ Job in Workbench, which will convert the time back to UTC before transmitting to Domo.


American Daylight Savings is taken into account for time zones in Workbench, but you may see the gaining or losing of an hour in your data depending on the time of year.


You apply a time zone to a DataSet using the **Shift Date Timezone** Transform. Note the UTC offset in the example below. In this case, 7 hours would be added to your datetime value in order to bring it inline with UTC.


![wb5_transforms_shift_timezone.png](wb5_transforms_shift_timezone.png)

5. Click the ![wb5_add_transform_icon.png](wb5_add_transform_icon.png)Â button.  
TheÂ **Filter Transform Editor**Â appears.
6. In the **Data Timezone**Â menu, select the desired time zone.
7. Click **Apply**.
8. Click ![wb5_save_icon.png](wb5_save_icon.png)Â at the top of the pane to save your transform.
